glsa.title: OpenSC: Insufficient protection of smart card PIN
glsa.synopsis: Smart cards formatted using OpenSC do not sufficiently protect the PIN, allowing attackers to reset it.

background.p: OpenSC is a smart card application that allows reading and writing via PKCS#11.

description.p: Chaskiel M Grundman reported that OpenSC uses weak permissions (ADMIN file control information of 00) for the 5015 directory on smart cards and USB crypto tokens running Siemens CardOS M4.

impact.p: A physically proximate attacker can exploit this vulnerability to change the PIN on a smart card and use it for authentication, leading to privilege escalation.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenSC users should upgrade to the latest version, and then check and update their smart cards:
